## Get Started

### Install and load required R packages

We use `library(tidyverse)` to load the collection of tidyverse packages, which includes `readr`, `ggplot2`, and others.

```{r}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse)
```

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Import the data

We read the CSV file containing exam data Make sure the file is located in the `data/` folder.

```{r}
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
head(exam_data)
```

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Plotting a simple bar chart

We plot the distribution of the `RACE` variable using `ggplot2`.

```{r}
ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = RACE)) +
  geom_bar(fill = "steelblue") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Number of Students by Race",
       x = "Race",
       y = "Count")
```
